page.title: 13ANCIENT BRITISH CAMPSITES
page.content: The whole area is covered with remains of Ancient British Campsites. By far the most accessible is the one at Brough law. On no other site are the boundaries so well defined. One other large site is that of Greaves' Ash. Despite the site being close to a well-trodden tourist path, very few people ever visit this site. This is probably because so much attention is focussed on Brough law. Nearly every other hill has remains on it though these remains are difficult to find being mostly covered by thick moorland vegetation.It is thought that the population of this area 2000 yrs ago must have far exceeded the population of the area as it stands today.
